reviews.review: Extremely rushed from the beginning until the end, as if meant to be two movies rather than one movie, with no sense of development yet filled with over-the-top twists that are not built up to but - rather - are ridiculously spontaneous in nature. Without spoiling it, "The Rise of Skywalker" feels like watching a chef overcook a salmon with oils bursting and popping from the pan onto the chef's skin and then onto us: the audience. For a Star Wars fan, it's disappointing and even insulting by Star Wars lore and by what's in "Force Awakens" and "The Last Jedi", proving that nothing was ever truly envisioned and/or planned from the "Force Awakens" onward. For a casual watcher, while visually pleasing, it is more of the style of "Fast & Furious" and - by being a trilogy - is notably inconsistent with past entries: being "Force Awakens" and "The Last Jedi". Therefore, a film for the brainless watching activity rather than for a film enthusiast. With its twists and MacGuffins constantly breaking even their own rules of logic, "The Rise of Skywalker" cannot be recommended for a true film enthusiast as it leaves a burnt and stale taste in the mouth that is only worsened if one had watched the past entries, and - at the same time - worsens memories of those past entries, which in itself is an astonishingly bad accomplishment. However, for the mindless looking for fun, I believe that there is a fun time to be had with no active thinking at all in "The Rise of Skywalker" - despite its horrible action sequences: "The Rise of Skywalker" is still a significantly high budget movie and is both visually and audibly pleasing.

Somewhat convoluted plot that introduces far too many things in this last instalment due to The Last Jedi subverting everything The Force Awakens set up and doing nothing to further the intrigue. However, once you look past that, The Rise of Skywalker is a very enjoyable film that manages to successfully land the ending and close the saga in a satisfying manner. This is by far not a perfect movie, but given that the previous film had set up nothing to resolve, this is as best of an outcome as one could have hoped.
after 42 yrs. a saga truly has an ending , awesome story telling ,direction ,acting. i am so satisfied of the outcome of this masterpiece.

Much better than I expected after that last Jedi dumpster ðŸ”¥. The pacing wasnâ€™t great and the final battle could have been better but no big failures. The story easily could have been a trilogy in itself. Overall, I enjoyed the film. The dumb comedy was kept to a minimum. There was no obvious agenda. It was just a good old fashioned sci-fi movie which these days is hard to find, especially from Disney. 8.5/10

I've heard some pretty terrible things about this movie, but in no way is it even close to being as dry or misguided as The Phantom Menace or Attack of the Clones. There were some truly excellent parts -- all associated with Kylo Ren/Ben Solo's character. But it felt like Star Wars-meets-Lord of the Rings-meets- Avengers: Endgame all rolled up into one. There were parts that felt forced, especially the ending sequence. It didn't feel very believable. But still thoroughly entertaining.

Not perfect by any means, but entertaining for sure! I wish these movies didn't rely so heavily on the fetch-quests so much. It makes for a good video game trope, but I don't feel Star Wars needs it so much. 

Loved all the new characters and the reveals, but felt bad for Rose being put out on the back burner and only having a few not important moments in the film. 

I'd recommend this and welcome it to my library once it becomes available for purchase.
It's worth a watch. Not the best one but it's the best one that cast & crew could make it. â™¥
Finally they use the force properly!

Expectation for a great film fell short to a weak storyline and plot conclusion. An SF type  Italian  space cowboy movie for the audience. Difficult to act with an illogical script dialog. 
    The tech stuff keep the movie from becoming  boring. I am not sure this movie will do much for the careers of the actors involved, except for the money!                          
     I have seen ALL of the previous Star Wars flics, just sorry this had to represent the last one. I did like the popcorn and coke Zero.
